snippet: Legislation that would allow people with concealed-gun permits to carry firearms into public schools and government meetings was approved 42 to 17 by the Republican-led State House on Monday.
abstract: Wyoming's Republican-led State House passes bill, 42-to-17, to allow people with concealed-gun permits to carry firearms into public schools and government meetings.
lead_paragraph: Legislation that would allow people with concealed-gun permits to carry firearms into public schools and government meetings was approved 42 to 17 by the Republican-led State House on Monday.

headline.main: Wyoming: House Passes Bill Expanding Concealed-Gun Rights
headline.print_headline: Wyoming: House Passes Bill Expanding Concealed-Gun Rights
